subject: Football
Retirement
lead_paragraph: The House Judiciary Committee intends to hold more hearings on the benefits programs for retired N.F.L. players. In releasing a 144-page report from the Congressional Research Service, the chairman John Conyers said additional government intervention was needed. The report did not make specific recommendations about how the league and the players union should change their benefits programs for retirees.
